title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 303.3 - Resolution of workers' compensation claims of certain officers and employees of the workers' compensation board and the state insurance fund
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 303.3 - Resolution of workers' compensation claims of certain officers and employees of the workers' compensation board and the state insurance fund

State Regulations
(a) Notwithstanding
subdivision 1 of section
20
of
the Workers' Compensation Law, any claims for compensation of the individuals
described below, including claims resulting from the death of such individuals, shall not be within the jurisdiction of the Workers' Compensation Board but
shall instead be determined in accordance with the rules and regulations herein
set forth: (1)
the chair, vice chair and
members of the Workers' Compensation Board; (2)
managerial or confidential employees of
the Workers' Compensation Board and State Insurance Fund who are allocated to a
grade M1 or above pursuant to section
130
of the

Civil Service Law; (3)
judges and
conciliators of the Workers' Compensation Board; and
(4)
the executive director, deputy executive
directors and members of the board of commissioners of the State Insurance

Fund. (b) An officer or
employee identified in subdivision (a) of this section shall hereinafter be
referred to as a designated officer or employee. (c) The Workers' Compensation Board and the

State Insurance Fund shall maintain current a list of all designated officers
and employees within their respective agencies, and shall notify designated
officers and employees that their claims for compensation are subject to the
terms of subdivision 2 of section
20
of
the Workers' Compensation Law and this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
303.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
